intro: Copiapoa laui, commonly known as the Laui's cactus, is a species of cactus native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive appearance, featuring a short, thick stem and dense, white to pale green spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring. Copiapoa laui is adapted to extreme arid conditions, storing water in its fleshy stem. It is a slow-growing plant, often cultivated for its unique beauty and resilience.
